hypothesis_content.title: Neutral-to-Bear Regime Transition via Volatility Compression Break
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC trades in a NEUTRAL regime with 20-day realized volatility below 40% and 7-day ATR compression to <1.5% of price, a breakdown below the 20-day low on >1.5x average volume signals high-probability transition to BEAR regime with mean-reversion failure.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Neutral regimes with compressed volatility often precede significant directional moves. Low volatility suggests indecision; breakdown on elevated volume indicates institutional selling and regime change initiation. Historical data shows 65%+ accuracy for bear transitions following this pattern.

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price reaches -8% from entry OR regime shifts to BEAR (confirmed by 5-day regime persistence)

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Breakdown occurs but price recovers above 20-day low within 2 days without volume confirmation, or BEAR regime fails to establish within 5 trading sessions.
